DataElement.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 7 Treatment or Medication Receiving for Pain Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation that describes treatment or medication name currently being received for pain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Treatment or Medication Receiving for Pain
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._A question about which treatments or medications an individual is receiving or has received for pain.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
